meanings.definition: A person who precedes another in a family line.
meanings.sent1: My great-grandfather was a forbearer of our family, setting a strong example for future generations.
meanings.sent2: The forbearer of the clan was known for his wisdom and leadership.
meanings.sent3: At family reunions, the forbearer always tells stories that make everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The forbearer of our family tree is like the roots that hold us together.
meanings.sent5: The forbearer's portrait hangs proudly in the family hall, a reminder of our heritage.

meanings.sent1: I had to forbearer from eating the tempting dessert to stick to my diet.
meanings.sent2: She had to forbearer from speaking out of turn during the important meeting.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child found it hard to forbearer from playing pranks on his siblings.
meanings.sent4: He decided to forbearer from making any hasty decisions until he had all the facts.
meanings.sent5: The doctor advised him to forbearer from strenuous exercise until his injury healed.
